results.title: Dr. Elizabeth Kubler Ross
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Monday Conference”.
Dr Elizabeth Kubler-Ross explains her treatment of the problems surrounding death and dying. She also details ways of dealing with the particular problems involved in coming to terms with the death of a young child

results.title: Dr Seuss on the loose: the Zax
results.creator_credit: Ted Geisel, Isadore Freleng, DePatie-Freleng Enterprises, CBS TV and Hawley Pratt
results.brief_description: A north-going Zax and a south-going Zax meet face-to-face on their journeys and neither is willing to budge. Their stubbornness and inability to change are presented most humorously in this animated film based on the original illustrations.

results.title: Dr Seuss on the loose: Sneetches
results.creator_credit: CBS, Isadore Freleng, Ted Geisel and Hawley Pratt
results.brief_description: Animated version of the Dr Seuss story from “Dr Seuss on the Loose”. This film implies that differences are only relative and in essence don’t matter. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Dr Leakey and the dawn of man
results.creator_credit: Nicolas Noxon and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: Highlights the discoveries of Dr Leakey and their implications for the study of human origins. Traces the development of the first theories about both the emergence of humans and their place of origin and examines the application of modern technology to the study of anthropology. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Paul Killiam Film Classic
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
This 1920’s film with John Barrymore was the first great American horror film. It was a tour-de-force for Barrymore, and a classic of macabre film making. This edited work retains all the ingredients for which it is famous. The narration points out its significance in motion picture history and provides interesting comment on the craftsmen who made it.

results.title: Dr Heidegger's experiment
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Short story showcase”.
An adaptation of Nathaniel Hawthorne’s symbolic tale of a wise old doctor who proves to his friends that age and wisdom are not necessarily synonymous.

results.title: Dr Fred D. Miller and the gateway to health
results.creator_credit: John Ott, John Ott Pictures and Robert Edmonds
results.brief_description: General physical health and hygiene practices as the basis of good dental health. A practising dentist shows how errors of diet and poor dental hygiene lead to poor teeth and avoidable cavities. Patients who have eaten the right foods all their lives and made a practice of finishing a meal with a crisp fruit have near-perfect teeth when in their fifties.
results.title_for_label: Dr Fred D. Miller and the gateway to health
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Ott, John Ott Pictures and Robert Edmonds

results.title: Down to Sussex
results.creator_credit: Edgar H. Anstey, British Transport Films and Kenneth J. Fairbairn
results.brief_description: South Down and Weald - open space and green woodland. This is Sussex, a county rich in scenic beauty. History shows itself everywhere, right back to the threshold of legend - The Long Man of Wilmington and Chanctonbury Ring. All this the present day traveller can see and enjoy, together with the present day delights of Petworth Show, Goodwood Races, polo at Cowdray Park, Glyndebourne and the Sussex Coast. Narrated by Peter Halliday.
